content.prompt: A system consists of two gases in separate containers isolated from their surroundings, as shown. The gas on the left side of the container has a temperature TL and the gas on the right side of the container has a greater temperature TR. The gases are initially separated by an insulating barrier. The barrier between the gases is then removed and the system is allowed to reach thermal equilibrium. Which of the following correctly compares the initial entropy of the system to the final entropy of the system?

choices.label: Initial entropy > Final entropy
Initial entropy = Final entropy
Initial entropy < Final entropy
The comparison cannot be made without knowing the values of the initial temperatures of the gases.

topic.text: 9.6: Entropy and the Second Law of Thermodynamics

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
